title: questions
body:
{JoeyDinger}
[[What was the first thing you did when you came home from your trip and realised that your bees were gone?|ilana1]]
[[Did you talk to Ilana before giving away her bees?|dwight1]]
[[Is there a way of baby-proofing against bees?|ilana2]]
[[Did something in particular lead you to believe that your wife’s bees might be dangerous for your child?|dwight2]]

title: ilana1
body:
{IlanaBishop}
My first thought was, he deadass stole my bees. I was under the impression that I was just thinking it. But I realised slowly that 
I was screaming it. I was hooting and hollering, screaming that he stole my bees.

[[...|ilana1a]]

title: ilana2
body:
{IlanaBishop}
I was not expecting to have my baby in the vicinity of my bees until it gets older. In the meantime, there are bee-keeping suits
for babies: look it up. Tiny baby bee-keeping suits, they are absolutely adorable.
I would completely murder someone for one.

[[Continue|questions]]

title: dwight1
body:
{DwightBishop}
I did not - like I said it was meant to be a surprise! Who wouldn’t appreciate a loving husband taking care of baby-proofing the
whole house?
I thought I was being helpful. I only ever had the safety of my wife and child in mind.

[[Continue|questions]]

title: dwight2
body:
{DwightBishop}
Well, Joey, they’re bees - they have stingers don’t they? I can see a curious baby, slithering its way outside, curious about the 
low-level buzzing sounds we all hear constantly, at all times. I can see it climbing its way inside a hive and being paid for 
its trouble in thousands of stingers! Those things are objectively dangerous, there’s no two ways about it.


[[Continue|questions]]

title: ilana1a
